projectPurpose: To provide a dedicated mod management tool specifically designed for "universal game mods" – modifications that can function across multiple games, often those built with the same engine, simplifying their discovery, installation, updating, and launching.
mainFeatures: Tool to help use and make universal game mods
Auto-find installed games from supported providers
Auto-find owned (but not necessarily installed) games from supported providers
Detect relevant information about each game, such as their game engine
Easily install/run the correct version of universal mods
Specific support for Praydog's UEVR (a universal VR mod for Unreal Engine games)

alternatives.name: Vortex Mod Manager
mainFeatures: Automatic load order sorting and conflict resolution

alternatives.name: Mod Organizer 2 (MO2)
mainFeatures: Virtual File System (VFS) for clean game directory
Detailed control over load order and conflicts

alternatives.name: CurseForge App
mainFeatures: Multi-game support (Minecraft, WoW, The Sims 4, etc.)

alternatives.name: Godot Universal Mod Manager
mainFeatures: Manages and creates mods for any Godot game without modifying game files
Provides basic API for managing mod data

marketPositioning: Rai Pal occupies a niche market position by focusing exclusively on "universal game mods" – modifications designed to function across multiple games, often leveraging common game engines. While general mod managers like Vortex and Mod Organizer 2 support multiple games, their primary function revolves around managing game-specific mod lists. Rai Pal differentiates itself by providing a dedicated tool for discovering, installing, and managing this specific class of mods, particularly highlighting its utility for universal VR mods like UEVR. It serves a distinct need for users interested in applying engine-level modifications across their game libraries, rather than managing individual mod collections for separate titles.
